channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-7331] Add access control for region open and close, row locking, and stopping the regionserver
item.description:
The following APIs in HRegionServer are either missing hooks to coprocessor or the hooks are not implemented in the AccessController class for security. As a result any unauthorized user can:

1.Open a region
2. Close a region
3. Stop region server
4. Lock a row
5. Unlock a row.
item.summary: Add access control for region open and close, row locking, and stopping the regionserver

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: For 0.96, HBASE-7315 would remove support for client-side RowLocks.
Thanks Ted Yu for pointing out.
First cut for the patch. I have the unit tests related to security and they pass.

Introduction of RegionServerObserver seems ok. The idea has been discussed also in HBASE-4047, see comment of 17/Nov/12 17:28.

The small refactor of how we do TableAuthManager.get looks ok.

Since you mention this is the first cut of a patch only, the formatting of the changes do not conform to our coding conventions. See http://hbase.apache.org/book/submitting.patches.html and http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/codeconv-138413.html . Especially, each indent level should be +2 spaces. Maybe some tabs got mixed in? Lines can be up to 100 chars long, no need to wrap before that. In this case I would have fixed up where it looks wrong on commit, but FYI more involved patches might not be accepted.

Trying out the patch.
Reparented this issue to HBASE-6096

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12560494/HBASE-7331_94.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/3491//console

This message is automatically generated.
All tests pass for me locally except for TestHBaseFsck#testRegionShouldNotBeDeployed, which seems an unrelated failure.
Fixed formatting errors. One of the small tests, TestLruCache fails for me intermittently, I am not sure if there is something wrong in my set up.

Fixed formatting errors.

Thanks. Looks like there may still be tabs in RegionServerCoprocessorHost but I'll fix that, no worries.

TestLruCache fails for me intermittently

That would seem unrelated.

Running another round of tests with the updated patch to see what's up, if anything.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12560684/HBASE-7331_94_02.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/3501//console

This message is automatically generated.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12560684/HBASE-7331_94_02.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/3505//console

This message is automatically generated.

All tests pass locally again with v2 patch except TestHBaseFsck#testRegionShouldNotBeDeployed, what appears to be an unrelated failure. Going to commit soon if no objection.

Lars Hofhansl Please consider the 0.94 patch for inclusion too. It's a low risk change that adds more hooks for checking admin permission before allowing actions that affect other users: stop the RS, close a region, open a region.
The 0.94 patch also requires CREATE or WRITE permission to use user row locks.
Committed to trunk. Thanks for the patch Vandana Ayyalasomayajula. Holding jira open for a decision on 0.94.

Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #3624 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/3624/)

Patch looks fine, does not seem to break existing functionality or introduce and incompatibilities.
I'll defer to you Andrew Purtell. If you think it's save, let's commit to 0.94.

Aren't we getting rid of rowlocks?

I'll defer to you Andrew Purtell. If you think it's save, let's commit to 0.94.

Ok, I'll commit it.

Aren't we getting rid of rowlocks?

We are, so the trunk patch doesn't have this, but they are still present in 0.94.
I'll add a @Deprecated tag to the rowlock stuff.

What I committed.

  • Added deprecation tags on rowlock related methods in RegionObserver interface.
  • Fixups for different requirePermission() in 0.94.
  • Added missing ASL headers on new files
  • Removed unused imports.
  • Changed some stray tabs to spaces.

TestAccessController with new cases passes for me locally.
Thanks for the patch Vandana Ayyalasomayajula!
